primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The 'Sunday Guy' (Jesus) interrupts the 'Saturday' of human despair and failure to restore and then mandate his followers for a new life of service and risk.

tekstueel_bewijs: The Sunday guy came upon him
He interrupted and changed their lives

object.identificatie: New life/The New World (Restoration and Mission)
tekstueel_bewijs: the first day of the new world
an alternative life of justice and compassion

zender.identificatie: The Sunday Guy / The Narrative of Easter
tekstueel_bewijs: The Sunday guy speaks in an imperative
The word from John and Saul is: expect to be interrupted
church people are the ones who have found their Saturday life abruptly interrupted
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer begins as Receiver (interrupted/fed) but is quickly transitioned into a secondary Subject (mandated).

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus is known in the church as the one who nourishes
Ananias... is to help this happen
helper.rol_van_god: God (Jesus) is the primary Subject who also provides the help (nourishment).
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit; the 'transformative presence' acts as the indwelling power.

tegenstander.identificatie: The 'Saturday' state / The Authorities / The Old Narratives
tekstueel_bewijs: the status quo cannot tolerate the Sunday guy
old narratives of money and power and violence
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits, but a 'lethal flatness' and systemic 'status quo' that crucifies the Subject.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Disciples (S) must feed the sheep (O) as a response to their restoration.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Disciples/Hearers
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon explicitly moves from the 'free breakfast' (Primary) to the 'work to do' (Secondary).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Easter Narrative → New Life → The Church

voorbeelden_god_subject: He surprised them by his presence
The Sunday guy speaks in an imperative

voorbeelden: They did know... but they could not compute it
Saturdays of overwhelming failure with no adequate resources
Jesus... nourishes and feeds and restores

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon starts with the lack of 'Pouvoir' (Saturday) but moves rapidly into 'Devoir' (Mandate) once the Subject is restored by Grace.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Saturday) to ~S2 (Interruption) to S1 (Sunday), then warns against ~S1 (Maintenance).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'Sunday Guy' who breaks the cycle of Saturday through an external intrusion.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; Saturday is described as 'lethal flatness' and 'ovens and genocides'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon is heavy on imperatives (mandate), it maintains a strict narrative hierarchy where God's action (Interruption/Feeding) precedes and enables human action.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: You be the shepherd. You restore life. You lay down your life.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He surprised them by his presence; he interrupted and changed their lives.
They had gotten a free breakfast. From now on, they have work to do.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Paul is used as a 'case study' to show the narrative 'touches down' in reality, but he is a subject of God's action first.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already leans theocentric by framing Paul's life as something 'Jesus tells' and 'Jesus shows'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Moves from despair to empowered responsibility.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Discipleship is a 'countercultural act' resulting from a 'divine abundance'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'free breakfast' to the 'mandate' is logically and theologically tight.
spanning_punten: The shift from 'Jesus feeds' to 'You feed' is abrupt and risks losing the 'Pouvoir' of the Spirit.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The Sunday guy who contradicts the status quo... the guy who started the world again.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'Sunday Guy' provides the competence through the 'food-gift'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; described as a 'lethal flatness' and 'overwhelming failure'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God/Jesus as the Subject of the primary narrative (Interruption/Salvation) and the Hearer as the Subject of the secondary narrative (Mission/Ethics).

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on Devoir (Mandate) in the second half.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase Pouvoir (the ongoing enabling of the Spirit).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that the 'Sunday Guy' doesn't just give the mandate and leave, but remains the source of the 'food-gift' during the mission.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The opponent (Death/Saturday/Status Quo) is already well-defined.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of maintaining the 'Grammar of Grace' while issuing a high-stakes call to discipleship.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Saturday/Sunday' metaphor; Greimas reveals that the metaphor functions as a Subject-switch from human failure to divine intrusion.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would explain the Greek for 'love'; Greimas shows that the 'three questions' are a modal test of the Subject's 'Vouloir' (Willingness).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that the 'mandate' is only possible because the Subject was first a 'Receiver' of the breakfast (Object of Value).

appendices.notnotes: The sermon avoids moralism by grounding the 'must' in the 'is' of the Easter event.
